TopicTitle: My plane is keeping on falling over since the update

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I am new to Kerbal space program, buying the game only a few days before the update. I worked hard on building an aircraft in my first few days, and eventually (through countless dead kerbals) I managed to build a medium altitude short range fighter-bomber called the DT-MKVIIIC, or what would later be known as the Thor II... Though since I was able to download the update every time I try to take off my plane tips over a few seconds up the runway! What is happening and how do I fix this?

Define \'tips over\'.

Also, you could check the flight report (F3?) to see if anything failed.

Perhaps attach a .craft file for the experts to fiddle with - the picture looks fine to me, but it\'s hard to tell without giving it a spin.

Okay, how do I attatch a .craft file?

The aircraft tips over to it\'s left or right, making one of the wings touch the ground, resulting in the destruction of the wing and the aircraft.
\'Attachments and other options\', just below the text field when you reply.

Thank you, it was just poor building on my part... the wings wheren\'t connected to the body properly... Thank you for replying, I would of spent hours trying to figure something out that was in front of my face the whole time.

I\'ve been having the same problem since .16 I think it\'s a bug.

My ships will constantly turn left/right (as if the thrust vector is making it turn), or the wheels will make my craft jerk left/right, and finally on top of that all, my plane will just tip over and fall to pieces WAY too easily, like you\'ve stated

It\'s not just the way you attached your wings, Daniel1324. I am also noticing that the dive-to-the-side-on-takeoff glitch seems to be worse in .16. In fact, there\'s a slight tendency to roll in level flight, and my first ship to orbit spun slowly as well. I made a stock parts rover that is completely unsteerable and just goes wherever it wants, ignoring my instructions. :\'( Wasn\'t that supposed to be fixed in this upgrade?

Not that I\'m complaining, because hey! Free-range Kerbals!
I\'m having the same problem since the latest patch.
